00057 #ifndef _xmlconfig_h

00059  
00060 // Uncomment this to enable wchar_t mode 
00061 // #define XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00062  
00063 // Uncomment this to disable XPath 
00064 // #define XML_NO_XPATH 
00065  
00066 // Uncomment this to disable STL 
00067 // Note: you can't use XPath with XML_NO_STL 
00068 // #define XML_NO_STL 
00069  
00070 // Uncomment this to disable exceptions 
00071 // Note: you can't use XPath with XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
00072 // #define XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS 
00073  
00074 // Set this to control attributes for public classes/functions, i.e.: 
00075 // #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllexport) // to export all public symbols from DLL 
00076 // #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllimport) // to import all classes from DLL 
00077 // #define PHYS_LIB __fastcall // to set calling conventions to all public functions to fastcall 
00078 // In absence of PHYS_LIB/PHYS_LIB definitions PHYS_LIB is used instead 
00079  
00080 #endif

00083 #define _H

00088 namespace std 
00089 { 
00090         struct bidirectional_iterator_tag; 
00091  
00092 #ifdef __SUNPRO_CC 
00093         // Sun C++ compiler has a bug which forces template argument names in forward declarations to be the same as in actual definitions 
00094         template <class _T> class allocator; 
00095         template <class _charT> struct char_traits; 
00096         template <class _charT, class _Traits> class basic_istream; 
00097         template <class _charT, class _Traits> class basic_ostream; 
00098         template <class _charT, class _Traits, class _Allocator> class basic_string; 
00099 #else 
00100         // Borland C++ compiler has a bug which forces template argument names in forward declarations to be the same as in actual definitions 
00101         template <class _Ty> class allocator; 
00102         template <class _Ty> struct char_traits; 
00103         template <class _Elem, class _Traits> class basic_istream; 
00104         template <class _Elem, class _Traits> class basic_ostream; 
00105         template <class _Elem, class _Traits, class _Ax> class basic_string; 
00106 #endif 
00107  
00108         // Digital Mars compiler has a bug which requires a forward declaration for explicit instantiation (otherwise type selection is messed up later, producing link errors) 
00109         // Also note that we have to declare char_traits as a class here, since it's defined that way 
00110 #ifdef __DMC__ 
00111         template <> class char_traits<char>; 
00112 #endif 
00113 } 
00114 #endif

00117 #ifndef XML_DEPRECATED 
00118 #       if defined(__GNUC__) 
00119 #               define XML_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated)) 
00120 #       elif defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1300 
00121 #               define XML_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated) 
00122 #       else 
00123 #               define XML_DEPRECATED 
00124 #       endif

00149 // Character interface macros 
00150 #ifdef XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00151 #       define XML_TEXT(t) L ## t 
00152 #       define XML_CHAR wchar_t 
00153 #else 
00154 #       define XML_TEXT(t) t 
00155 #       define XML_CHAR char 
00156 #endif

00159 namespace phys
00160 { namespace xml
00161 { 
00162         // Character type used for all internal storage and operations; depends on XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00163         typedef XML_CHAR char_t; 
00164  
00165 #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00166         // String type used for operations that work with STL string; depends on XML_WCHAR_MODE 
00167         typedef std::basic_string<XML_CHAR, std::char_traits<XML_CHAR>, std::allocator<XML_CHAR> > string_t; 
00168 #endif 
00169 }

00172 // The PugiXML namespace 
00173 
00174 namespace phys
00175 { namespace xml
00176 { 
00177         // Tree node types 
00178         enum Node_Type 
00179         { 
00180                 node_null,                // Empty (null) node handle 
00181                 node_document,          // A document tree's absolute root 
00182                 node_element,           // Element tag, i.e. '<node/>' 
00183                 node_pcdata,            // Plain character data, i.e. 'text' 
00184                 node_cdata,                     // Character data, i.e. '<![CDATA[text]]>' 
00185                 node_comment,           // Comment tag, i.e. '<!-- text -->' 
00186                 node_pi,                        // Processing instruction, i.e. '<?name?>' 
00187                 node_declaration,       // Document declaration, i.e. '<?xml version="1.0"?>' 
00188                 node_doctype            // Document type declaration, i.e. '<!DOCTYPE doc>' 
00189         }; 
00190  
00191         // Parsing options 
00192  
00193         // Minimal parsing mode (equivalent to turning all other flags off). 
00194         // Only elements and PCDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, no text conversions are performed. 
00195         const unsigned int parse_minimal = 0x0000; 
00196  
00197         // This flag determines if processing instructions (node_pi) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00198         const unsigned int parse_pi = 0x0001; 
00199  
00200         // This flag determines if comments (node_comment) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00201         const unsigned int parse_comments = 0x0002; 
00202  
00203         // This flag determines if CDATA sections (node_cdata) are added to the DOM tree. This flag is on by default. 
00204         const unsigned int parse_cdata = 0x0004; 
00205  
00206         // This flag determines if plain character data (node_pcdata) that consist only of whitespace are added to the DOM tree. 
00207         // This flag is off by default; turning it on usually results in slower parsing and more memory consumption. 
00208         const unsigned int parse_ws_pcdata = 0x0008; 
00209  
00210         // This flag determines if character and entity references are expanded during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00211         const unsigned int parse_escapes = 0x0010; 
00212  
00213         // This flag determines if EOL characters are normalized (converted to #xA) during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00214         const unsigned int parse_eol = 0x0020; 
00215          
00216         // This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules during parsing. This flag is on by default. 
00217         const unsigned int parse_wconv_attribute = 0x0040; 
00218  
00219         // This flag determines if attribute values are normalized using NMTOKENS normalization rules during parsing. This flag is off by default. 
00220         const unsigned int parse_wnorm_attribute = 0x0080; 
00221          
00222         // This flag determines if document declaration (node_declaration) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00223         const unsigned int parse_declaration = 0x0100; 
00224  
00225         // This flag determines if document type declaration (node_doctype) is added to the DOM tree. This flag is off by default. 
00226         const unsigned int parse_doctype = 0x0200; 
00227  
00228         // The default parsing mode. 
00229         // Elements, PCDATA and CDATA sections are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded, 
00230         // End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules. 
00231         const unsigned int parse_default = parse_cdata | parse_escapes | parse_wconv_attribute | parse_eol; 
00232  
00233         // The full parsing mode. 
00234         // Nodes of all types are added to the DOM tree, character/reference entities are expanded, 
00235         // End-of-Line characters are normalized, attribute values are normalized using CDATA normalization rules. 
00236         const unsigned int parse_full = parse_default | parse_pi | parse_comments | parse_declaration | parse_doctype; 
00237  
00238         // These flags determine the encoding of input data for XML document 
00239         enum Encoding 
00240         { 
00241                 encoding_auto,    // Auto-detect input encoding using BOM or < / <? detection; use UTF8 if BOM is not found 
00242                 encoding_utf8,    // UTF8 encoding 
00243                 encoding_utf16_le,  // Little-endian UTF16 
00244                 encoding_utf16_be,  // Big-endian UTF16 
00245                 encoding_utf16,  // UTF16 with native endianness 
00246                 encoding_utf32_le,  // Little-endian UTF32 
00247                 encoding_utf32_be,  // Big-endian UTF32 
00248                 encoding_utf32,  // UTF32 with native endianness 
00249                 encoding_wchar    // The same encoding wchar_t has (either UTF16 or UTF32) 
00250         }; 
00251  
00252         // Formatting flags 
00253          
00254         // Indent the nodes that are written to output stream with as many indentation strings as deep the node is in DOM tree. This flag is on by default. 
00255         const unsigned int format_indent = 0x01; 
00256          
00257         // Write encoding-specific BOM to the output stream. This flag is off by default. 
00258         const unsigned int format_write_bom = 0x02; 
00259  
00260         // Use raw output mode (no indentation and no line breaks are written). This flag is off by default. 
00261         const unsigned int format_raw = 0x04; 
00262          
00263         // Omit default XML declaration even if there is no declaration in the document. This flag is off by default. 
00264         const unsigned int format_no_declaration = 0x08; 
00265  
00266         // The default set of formatting flags. 
00267         // Nodes are indented depending on their depth in DOM tree, a default declaration is output if document has none. 
00268         const unsigned int format_default = format_indent; 
00269

00288         // Writer interface for node printing (see Node::print) 
00289         class PHYS_LIB Writer 
00290         { 
00291         public: 
00292                 virtual ~Writer() {} 
00293  
00294                 // Write memory chunk into stream/file/whatever 
00295                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size) = 0; 
00296         }; 
00297  
00298         // Writer implementation for FILE* 
00299         class PHYS_LIB Writer_File: public Writer 
00300         { 
00301         public: 
00302                 // Construct writer from a FILE* object; void* is used to avoid header dependencies on stdio 
00303                 Writer_File(void* file); 
00304  
00305                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size); 
00306  
00307         private: 
00308                 void* file; 
00309         }; 
00310  
00311         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00312         // Writer implementation for streams 
00313         class PHYS_LIB Writer_Stream: public Writer 
00314         { 
00315         public: 
00316                 // Construct writer from an output stream object 
00317                 Writer_Stream(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream); 
00318                 Writer_Stream(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream); 
00319  
00320                 virtual void write(const void* data, size_t size); 
00321  
00322         private: 
00323                 std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >* narrow_stream; 
00324                 std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >* wide_stream; 
00325         }; 
00326         #endif

00328         // A light-weight handle for manipulating attributes in DOM tree 
00329         class PHYS_LIB Attribute 
00330         { 
00331                 friend class Attribute_Iterator; 
00332                 friend class Node; 
00333  
00334         private: 
00335                 Attribute_Struct* _attr; 
00336          
00337                 typedef Attribute_Struct* Attribute::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00338  
00339         public: 
00340                 // Default constructor. Constructs an empty attribute. 
00341                 Attribute(); 
00342                  
00343                 // Constructs attribute from internal pointer 
00344                 explicit Attribute(Attribute_Struct* attr); 
00345  
00346                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
00347                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
00348  
00349                 // Borland C++ workaround 
00350                 bool operator!() const; 
00351  
00352                 // Comparison operators (compares wrapped attribute pointers) 
00353                 bool operator==(const Attribute& r) const; 
00354                 bool operator!=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00355                 bool operator<(const Attribute& r) const; 
00356                 bool operator>(const Attribute& r) const; 
00357                 bool operator<=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00358                 bool operator>=(const Attribute& r) const; 
00359  
00360                 // Check if attribute is empty 
00361                 bool empty() const; 
00362  
00363                 // Get attribute name/value, or "" if attribute is empty 
00364                 const char_t* name() const; 
00365                 const char_t* value() const; 
00366  
00367                 // Get attribute value as a number, or 0 if conversion did not succeed or attribute is empty 
00368                 int as_int() const; 
00369                 unsigned int as_uint() const; 
00370                 double as_double() const; 
00371                 float as_float() const; 
00372  
00373                 // Get attribute value as bool (returns true if first character is in '1tTyY' set), or false if attribute is empty 
00374                 bool as_bool() const; 
00375  
00376                 // Set attribute name/value (returns false if attribute is empty or there is not enough memory) 
00377                 bool set_name(const char_t* rhs); 
00378                 bool set_value(const char_t* rhs); 
00379  
00380                 // Set attribute value with type conversion (numbers are converted to strings, boolean is converted to "true"/"false") 
00381                 bool set_value(int rhs); 
00382                 bool set_value(unsigned int rhs); 
00383                 bool set_value(double rhs); 
00384                 bool set_value(bool rhs); 
00385  
00386                 // Set attribute value (equivalent to set_value without error checking) 
00387                 Attribute& operator=(const char_t* rhs); 
00388                 Attribute& operator=(int rhs); 
00389                 Attribute& operator=(unsigned int rhs); 
00390                 Attribute& operator=(double rhs); 
00391                 Attribute& operator=(bool rhs); 
00392  
00393                 // Get next/previous attribute in the attribute list of the parent node 
00394                 Attribute next_attribute() const; 
00395                 Attribute previous_attribute() const; 
00396  
00397                 // Get hash value (unique for handles to the same object) 
00398                 size_t hash_value() const; 
00399  
00400                 // Get internal pointer 
00401                 Attribute_Struct* internal_object() const; 
00402         }; 
00403  
00404 #ifdef __BORLANDC__ 
00405         // Borland C++ workaround 
00406         bool PHYS_LIB operator&&(const Attribute& lhs, bool rhs); 
00407         bool PHYS_LIB operator||(const Attribute& lhs, bool rhs); 
00408 #endif

00410         // A light-weight handle for manipulating nodes in DOM tree 
00411         class PHYS_LIB Node 
00412         { 
00413                 friend class Attribute_Iterator; 
00414                 friend class Node_Iterator; 
00415  
00416         protected: 
00417                 Node_Struct* _root; 
00418  
00419                 typedef Node_Struct* Node::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00420  
00421         public: 
00422                 // Default constructor. Constructs an empty node. 
00423                 Node(); 
00424  
00425                 // Constructs node from internal pointer 
00426                 explicit Node(Node_Struct* p); 
00427  
00428                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
00429                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
00430  
00431                 // Borland C++ workaround 
00432                 bool operator!() const; 
00433          
00434                 // Comparison operators (compares wrapped node pointers) 
00435                 bool operator==(const Node& r) const; 
00436                 bool operator!=(const Node& r) const; 
00437                 bool operator<(const Node& r) const; 
00438                 bool operator>(const Node& r) const; 
00439                 bool operator<=(const Node& r) const; 
00440                 bool operator>=(const Node& r) const; 
00441  
00442                 // Check if node is empty. 
00443                 bool empty() const; 
00444  
00445                 // Get node type 
00446                 Node_Type type() const; 
00447  
00448                 // Get node name/value, or "" if node is empty or it has no name/value 
00449                 const char_t* name() const; 
00450                 const char_t* value() const; 
00451          
00452                 // Get attribute list 
00453                 Attribute first_attribute() const; 
00454                 Attribute last_attribute() const; 
00455  
00456                 // Get children list 
00457                 Node first_child() const; 
00458                 Node last_child() const; 
00459  
00460                 // Get next/previous sibling in the children list of the parent node 
00461                 Node next_sibling() const; 
00462                 Node previous_sibling() const; 
00463                  
00464                 // Get parent node 
00465                 Node parent() const; 
00466  
00467                 // Get root of DOM tree this node belongs to 
00468                 Node root() const; 
00469  
00470                 // Get child, attribute or next/previous sibling with the specified name 
00471                 Node child(const char_t* name) const; 
00472                 Attribute attribute(const char_t* name) const; 
00473                 Node next_sibling(const char_t* name) const; 
00474                 Node previous_sibling(const char_t* name) const; 
00475  
00476                 // Get child value of current node; that is, value of the first child node of type PCDATA/CDATA 
00477                 const char_t* child_value() const; 
00478  
00479                 // Get child value of child with specified name. Equivalent to child(name).child_value(). 
00480                 const char_t* child_value(const char_t* name) const; 
00481  
00482                 // Set node name/value (returns false if node is empty, there is not enough memory, or node can not have name/value) 
00483                 bool set_name(const char_t* rhs); 
00484                 bool set_value(const char_t* rhs); 
00485                  
00486                 // Add attribute with specified name. Returns added attribute, or empty attribute on errors. 
00487                 Attribute append_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00488                 Attribute prepend_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00489                 Attribute insert_attribute_after(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr); 
00490                 Attribute insert_attribute_before(const char_t* name, const Attribute& attr); 
00491  
00492                 // Add a copy of the specified attribute. Returns added attribute, or empty attribute on errors. 
00493                 Attribute append_copy(const Attribute& proto); 
00494                 Attribute prepend_copy(const Attribute& proto); 
00495                 Attribute insert_copy_after(const Attribute& proto, const Attribute& attr); 
00496                 Attribute insert_copy_before(const Attribute& proto, const Attribute& attr); 
00497  
00498                 // Add child node with specified type. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00499                 Node append_child(Node_Type type = node_element); 
00500                 Node prepend_child(Node_Type type = node_element); 
00501                 Node insert_child_after(Node_Type type, const Node& node); 
00502                 Node insert_child_before(Node_Type type, const Node& node); 
00503  
00504                 // Add child element with specified name. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00505                 Node append_child(const char_t* name); 
00506                 Node prepend_child(const char_t* name); 
00507                 Node insert_child_after(const char_t* name, const Node& node); 
00508                 Node insert_child_before(const char_t* name, const Node& node); 
00509  
00510                 // Add a copy of the specified node as a child. Returns added node, or empty node on errors. 
00511                 Node append_copy(const Node& proto); 
00512                 Node prepend_copy(const Node& proto); 
00513                 Node insert_copy_after(const Node& proto, const Node& node); 
00514                 Node insert_copy_before(const Node& proto, const Node& node); 
00515  
00516                 // Remove specified attribute 
00517                 bool remove_attribute(const Attribute& a); 
00518                 bool remove_attribute(const char_t* name); 
00519  
00520                 // Remove specified child 
00521                 bool remove_child(const Node& n); 
00522                 bool remove_child(const char_t* name); 
00523  
00524                 // Find attribute using predicate. Returns first attribute for which predicate returned true. 
00525                 template <typename Predicate> Attribute find_attribute(Predicate pred) const 
00526                 { 
00527                         if (!_root) return Attribute(); 
00528                          
00529                         for (Attribute attrib = first_attribute(); attrib; attrib = attrib.next_attribute()) 
00530                                 if (pred(attrib)) 
00531                                         return attrib; 
00532                  
00533                         return Attribute(); 
00534                 } 
00535  
00536                 // Find child node using predicate. Returns first child for which predicate returned true. 
00537                 template <typename Predicate> Node find_child(Predicate pred) const 
00538                 { 
00539                         if (!_root) return Node(); 
00540          
00541                         for (Node node = first_child(); node; node = node.next_sibling()) 
00542                                 if (pred(node)) 
00543                                         return node; 
00544                  
00545                         return Node(); 
00546                 } 
00547  
00548                 // Find node from subtree using predicate. Returns first node from subtree (depth-first), for which predicate returned true. 
00549                 template <typename Predicate> Node find_node(Predicate pred) const 
00550                 { 
00551                         if (!_root) return Node(); 
00552  
00553                         Node cur = first_child(); 
00554                          
00555                         while (cur._root && cur._root != _root) 
00556                         { 
00557                                 if (pred(cur)) return cur; 
00558  
00559                                 if (cur.first_child()) cur = cur.first_child(); 
00560                                 else if (cur.next_sibling()) cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
00561                                 else 
00562                                 { 
00563                                         while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur._root != _root) cur = cur.parent(); 
00564  
00565                                         if (cur._root != _root) cur = cur.next_sibling(); 
00566                                 } 
00567                         } 
00568  
00569                         return Node(); 
00570                 } 
00571  
00572                 // Find child node by attribute name/value 
00573                 Node find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* name, const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const; 
00574                 Node find_child_by_attribute(const char_t* attr_name, const char_t* attr_value) const;

00578                 string_t path(char_t delimiter = '/') const; 
00579         #endif

00582                 Node first_element_by_path(const char_t* path, char_t delimiter = '/') const;

00584                 // Recursively traverse subtree with Tree_Walker 
00585                 bool traverse(Tree_Walker& walker); 
00586

00588                 // Select single node by evaluating XPath query. Returns first node from the resulting node set. 
00589                 xpath_node select_single_node(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables = 0) const; 
00590                 xpath_node select_single_node(const xpath_query& query) const; 
00591  
00592                 // Select node set by evaluating XPath query 
00593                 xpath_node_set select_nodes(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables = 0) const; 
00594                 xpath_node_set select_nodes(const xpath_query& query) const; 
00595         #endif 
00596                  
00597                 // Print subtree using a writer object 
00598                 void print(Writer& writer, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto, unsigned int depth = 0) const; 
00599  
00600         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00601                 // Print subtree to stream 
00602                 void print(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& os, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto, unsigned int depth = 0) const; 
00603                 void print(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& os, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, unsigned int depth = 0) const; 
00604         #endif 
00605  
00606                 // Child nodes iterators 
00607                 typedef Node_Iterator iterator; 
00608  
00609                 iterator begin() const; 
00610                 iterator end() const; 
00611  
00612                 // Attribute iterators 
00613                 typedef Attribute_Iterator attribute_iterator; 
00614  
00615                 attribute_iterator attributes_begin() const; 
00616                 attribute_iterator attributes_end() const; 
00617  
00618                 // Get node offset in parsed file/string (in char_t units) for debugging purposes 
00619                 ptrdiff_t offset_debug() const; 
00620  
00621                 // Get hash value (unique for handles to the same object) 
00622                 size_t hash_value() const; 
00623  
00624                 // Get internal pointer 
00625                 Node_Struct* internal_object() const; 
00626         }; 
00627

00631         bool PHYS_LIB operator||(const Node& lhs, bool rhs);

00634         // Child node iterator (a bidirectional iterator over a collection of Node) 
00635         class PHYS_LIB Node_Iterator

00648                 typedef Node value_type; 
00649                 typedef Node* pointer; 
00650                 typedef Node& reference;

00654         #endif

00673                 Node_Iterator operator--(int);

00718         // Abstract tree walker class (see Node::traverse) 
00719         class PHYS_LIB Tree_Walker 
00720         { 
00721                 friend class Node; 
00722  
00723         private: 
00724                 int _depth; 
00725          
00726         protected: 
00727                 // Get current traversal depth 
00728                 int depth() const; 
00729          
00730         public: 
00731                 Tree_Walker(); 
00732                 virtual ~Tree_Walker(); 
00733  
00734                 // Callback that is called when traversal begins 
00735                 virtual bool begin(Node& node); 
00736  
00737                 // Callback that is called for each node traversed 
00738                 virtual bool for_each(Node& node) = 0; 
00739  
00740                 // Callback that is called when traversal ends 
00741                 virtual bool end(Node& node); 
00742         }; 
00743  
00744         // Parsing status, returned as part of Parse_Result object 
00745         enum Parse_Status 
00746         { 
00747                 status_ok = 0,                    // No error 
00748  
00749                 status_file_not_found,    // File was not found during load_file() 
00750                 status_io_error,                        // Error reading from file/stream 
00751                 status_out_of_memory,      // Could not allocate memory 
00752                 status_internal_error,    // Internal error occurred 
00753  
00754                 status_unrecognized_tag,        // Parser could not determine tag type 
00755  
00756                 status_bad_pi,                    // Parsing error occurred while parsing document declaration/processing instruction 
00757                 status_bad_comment,              // Parsing error occurred while parsing comment 
00758                 status_bad_cdata,                  // Parsing error occurred while parsing CDATA section 
00759                 status_bad_doctype,              // Parsing error occurred while parsing document type declaration 
00760                 status_bad_pcdata,                // Parsing error occurred while parsing PCDATA section 
00761                 status_bad_start_element,   // Parsing error occurred while parsing start element tag 
00762                 status_bad_attribute,      // Parsing error occurred while parsing element attribute 
00763                 status_bad_end_element,  // Parsing error occurred while parsing end element tag 
00764                 status_end_element_mismatch // There was a mismatch of start-end tags (closing tag had incorrect name, some tag was not closed or there was an excessive closing tag) 
00765         }; 
00766  
00767         // Parsing result 
00768         struct PHYS_LIB Parse_Result 
00769         { 
00770                 // Parsing status (see Parse_Status) 
00771                 Parse_Status status; 
00772  
00773                 // Last parsed offset (in char_t units from start of input data) 
00774                 ptrdiff_t offset; 
00775  
00776                 // Source document encoding 
00777                 Encoding encoding; 
00778  
00779                 // Default constructor, initializes object to failed state 
00780                 Parse_Result(); 
00781  
00782                 // Cast to bool operator 
00783                 operator bool() const; 
00784  
00785                 // Get error description 
00786                 const char* description() const; 
00787         }; 
00788  
00789         // Document class (DOM tree root) 
00790         class PHYS_LIB Document: public Node 
00791         { 
00792         private: 
00793                 char_t* _buffer; 
00794  
00795                 char _memory[192]; 
00796                  
00797                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00798                 Document(const Document&); 
00799                 const Document& operator=(const Document&); 
00800  
00801                 void create(); 
00802                 void destroy(); 
00803  
00804                 Parse_Result load_buffer_impl(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, Encoding encoding, bool is_mutable, bool own); 
00805  
00806         public: 
00807                 // Default constructor, makes empty document 
00808                 Document(); 
00809  
00810                 // Destructor, invalidates all node/attribute handles to this document 
00811                 ~Document(); 
00812  
00813                 // Removes all nodes, leaving the empty document 
00814                 void reset(); 
00815  
00816                 // Removes all nodes, then copies the entire contents of the specified document 
00817                 void reset(const Document& proto); 
00818  
00819         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00820                 // Load document from stream. 
00821                 Parse_Result load(std::basic_istream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00822                 Parse_Result load(std::basic_istream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, unsigned int options = parse_default); 
00823         #endif 
00824  
00825                 // Load document from zero-terminated string. No encoding conversions are applied. 
00826                 Parse_Result load(const char_t* contents, unsigned int options = parse_default); 
00827  
00828                 // Load document from file 
00829                 Parse_Result load_file(const char* path, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00830                 Parse_Result load_file(const wchar_t* path, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00831  
00832                 // Load document from buffer. Copies/converts the buffer, so it may be deleted or changed after the function returns. 
00833                 Parse_Result load_buffer(const void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00834  
00835                 // Load document from buffer, using the buffer for in-place parsing (the buffer is modified and used for storage of document data). 
00836                 // You should ensure that buffer data will persist throughout the document's lifetime, and free the buffer memory manually once document is destroyed. 
00837                 Parse_Result load_buffer_inplace(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00838  
00839                 // Load document from buffer, using the buffer for in-place parsing (the buffer is modified and used for storage of document data). 
00840                 // You should allocate the buffer with pugixml allocation function; document will free the buffer when it is no longer needed (you can't use it anymore). 
00841                 Parse_Result load_buffer_inplace_own(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options = parse_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto); 
00842  
00843                 // Save XML document to writer (semantics is slightly different from Node::print, see documentation for details). 
00844                 void save(Writer& writer, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto) const; 
00845  
00846         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00847                 // Save XML document to stream (semantics is slightly different from Node::print, see documentation for details). 
00848                 void save(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto) const; 
00849                 void save(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default) const; 
00850         #endif 
00851  
00852                 // Save XML to file 
00853                 bool save_file(const char* path, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto) const; 
00854                 bool save_file(const wchar_t* path, const char_t* indent = XML_TEXT("\t"), unsigned int flags = format_default, Encoding encoding = encoding_auto) const; 
00855  
00856                 // Get document element 
00857                 Node document_element() const; 
00858         };

00861         // XPath query return type 
00862         enum xpath_value_type 
00863         { 
00864                 xpath_type_none,          // Unknown type (query failed to compile) 
00865                 xpath_type_node_set,  // Node set (xpath_node_set) 
00866                 xpath_type_number,      // Number 
00867                 xpath_type_string,      // String 
00868                 xpath_type_boolean      // Boolean 
00869         };

00878                 ptrdiff_t offset;

00881                 xpath_parse_result(); 
00882

00884                 operator bool() const; 
00885  
00886                 // Get error description 
00887                 const char* description() const; 
00888         };

00890         // A single XPath variable 
00891         class PHYS_LIB xpath_variable 
00892         { 
00893                 friend class xpath_variable_set; 
00894  
00895         protected: 
00896                 xpath_value_type _type; 
00897                 xpath_variable* _next; 
00898  
00899                 xpath_variable(); 
00900  
00901                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00902                 xpath_variable(const xpath_variable&); 
00903                 xpath_variable& operator=(const xpath_variable&); 
00904                  
00905         public: 
00906                 // Get variable name 
00907                 const char_t* name() const; 
00908  
00909                 // Get variable type 
00910                 xpath_value_type type() const; 
00911  
00912                 // Get variable value; no type conversion is performed, default value (false, NaN, empty string, empty node set) is returned on type mismatch error 
00913                 bool get_boolean() const; 
00914                 double get_number() const; 
00915                 const char_t* get_string() const; 
00916                 const xpath_node_set& get_node_set() const; 
00917  
00918                 // Set variable value; no type conversion is performed, false is returned on type mismatch error 
00919                 bool set(bool value); 
00920                 bool set(double value); 
00921                 bool set(const char_t* value); 
00922                 bool set(const xpath_node_set& value); 
00923         }; 
00924  
00925         // A set of XPath variables 
00926         class PHYS_LIB xpath_variable_set 
00927         { 
00928         private: 
00929                 xpath_variable* _data[64]; 
00930  
00931                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00932                 xpath_variable_set(const xpath_variable_set&); 
00933                 xpath_variable_set& operator=(const xpath_variable_set&); 
00934  
00935                 xpath_variable* find(const char_t* name) const; 
00936  
00937         public: 
00938                 // Default constructor/destructor 
00939                 xpath_variable_set(); 
00940                 ~xpath_variable_set(); 
00941  
00942                 // Add a new variable or get the existing one, if the types match 
00943                 xpath_variable* add(const char_t* name, xpath_value_type type); 
00944  
00945                 // Set value of an existing variable; no type conversion is performed, false is returned if there is no such variable or if types mismatch 
00946                 bool set(const char_t* name, bool value); 
00947                 bool set(const char_t* name, double value); 
00948                 bool set(const char_t* name, const char_t* value); 
00949                 bool set(const char_t* name, const xpath_node_set& value); 
00950  
00951                 // Get existing variable by name 
00952                 xpath_variable* get(const char_t* name); 
00953                 const xpath_variable* get(const char_t* name) const; 
00954         };

00956         // A compiled XPath query object 
00957         class PHYS_LIB xpath_query 
00958         { 
00959         private: 
00960                 void* _impl; 
00961                 xpath_parse_result _result; 
00962  
00963                 typedef void* xpath_query::*unspecified_bool_type; 
00964  
00965                 // Non-copyable semantics 
00966                 xpath_query(const xpath_query&); 
00967                 xpath_query& operator=(const xpath_query&); 
00968  
00969         public: 
00970                 // Construct a compiled object from XPath expression. 
00971                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws xpath_exception on compilation errors. 
00972                 explicit xpath_query(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables = 0); 
00973  
00974                 // Destructor 
00975                 ~xpath_query(); 
00976  
00977                 // Get query expression return type 
00978                 xpath_value_type return_type() const; 
00979                  
00980                 // Evaluate expression as boolean value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00981                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00982                 bool evaluate_boolean(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00983                  
00984                 // Evaluate expression as double value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00985                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00986                 double evaluate_number(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00987                  
00988         #ifndef XML_NO_STL 
00989                 // Evaluate expression as string value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00990                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00991                 string_t evaluate_string(const xpath_node& n) const; 
00992         #endif 
00993                  
00994                 // Evaluate expression as string value in the specified context; performs type conversion if necessary. 
00995                 // At most capacity characters are written to the destination buffer, full result size is returned (includes terminating zero). 
00996                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
00997                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is defined, returns empty  set instead. 
00998                 size_t evaluate_string(char_t* buffer, size_t capacity, const xpath_node& n) const; 
00999  
01000                 // Evaluate expression as node set in the specified context. 
01001                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is not defined, throws xpath_exception on type mismatch and std::bad_alloc on out of memory errors. 
01002                 // If XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS is defined, returns empty node set instead. 
01003                 xpath_node_set evaluate_node_set(const xpath_node& n) const; 
01004  
01005                 // Get parsing result (used to get compilation errors in XML_NO_EXCEPTIONS mode) 
01006                 const xpath_parse_result& result() const; 
01007  
01008                 // Safe bool conversion operator 
01009                 operator unspecified_bool_type() const; 
01010  
01011                 // Borland C++ workaround 
01012                 bool operator!() const; 
01013         };

01075         // A fixed-size collection of XPath nodes 
01076         class PHYS_LIB xpath_node_set 
01077         { 
01078         public: 
01079                 // Collection type 
01080                 enum type_t 
01081                 { 
01082                         type_unsorted,                  // Not ordered 
01083                         type_sorted,                    // Sorted by document order (ascending) 
01084                         type_sorted_reverse             // Sorted by document order (descending) 
01085                 }; 
01086                  
01087                 // Constant iterator type 
01088                 typedef const xpath_node* const_iterator; 
01089          
01090                 // Default constructor. Constructs empty set. 
01091                 xpath_node_set(); 
01092  
01093                 // Constructs a set from iterator range; data is not checked for duplicates and is not sorted according to provided type, so be careful 
01094                 xpath_node_set(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end, type_t type = type_unsorted); 
01095  
01096                 // Destructor 
01097                 ~xpath_node_set(); 
01098                  
01099                 // Copy constructor/assignment operator 
01100                 xpath_node_set(const xpath_node_set& ns); 
01101                 xpath_node_set& operator=(const xpath_node_set& ns); 
01102  
01103                 // Get collection type 
01104                 type_t type() const; 
01105                  
01106                 // Get collection size 
01107                 size_t size() const; 
01108  
01109                 // Indexing operator 
01110                 const xpath_node& operator[](size_t index) const; 
01111                  
01112                 // Collection iterators 
01113                 const_iterator begin() const; 
01114                 const_iterator end() const; 
01115  
01116                 // Sort the collection in ascending/descending order by document order 
01117                 void sort(bool reverse = false); 
01118                  
01119                 // Get first node in the collection by document order 
01120                 xpath_node first() const; 
01121                  
01122                 // Check if collection is empty 
01123                 bool empty() const; 
01124          
01125         private: 
01126                 type_t _type; 
01127                  
01128                 xpath_node _storage; 
01129                  
01130                 xpath_node* _begin; 
01131                 xpath_node* _end; 
01132  
01133                 void _assign(const_iterator begin, const_iterator end); 
01134         }; 
01135 #endif

01147         // Memory allocation function interface; returns pointer to allocated memory or NULL on failure 
01148         typedef void* (*allocation_function)(size_t size); 
01149          
01150         // Memory deallocation function interface 
01151         typedef void (*deallocation_function)(void* ptr); 
01152  
01153         // Override default memory management functions. All subsequent allocations/deallocations will be performed via supplied functions. 
01154         void PHYS_LIB set_memory_management_functions(allocation_function allocate, deallocation_function deallocate); 
01155          
01156         // Get current memory management functions 
01157         allocation_function PHYS_LIB get_memory_allocation_function(); 
01158         deallocation_function PHYS_LIB get_memory_deallocation_function();
